answers.answer: I know they monitor you closely during your pregnancy if you have high BP.   However, I never heard that this was an indication for a c-section.   If your blood pressure were high at around the time of delivery for some reason and you were in danger during delivery , they'd probaby do a c-section.   however, asthmas, diabetes, and/or HP don't automatically mean c-section.   Esp if controlled.I had preeclamsia with my pregnancy.  My BP was slightly elevated, however, it wasn't the plan for c-section.   We planned for vaginal delivery.Basically you will know if you have a c-section closer to your delivery date.   But it's not automatic indication for c-section.   The other problem is you are probably at risk for pre-eclampsia because of your high blood pressure. But only time will tell if that will be a problem for you.....Here's a good link from march of dimes.  I hope it helps.http://www.marchofdimes.com/professionals/14332_1222.asp

Thanks for the info.I was reading some information about pe last night and its almost the opposite to what I thought. It seemed to be what you said, it's  more likely they'd want you to do vaginal delivery because a c-section maybe be worse for blood pressure issues.Yikes.
Well I hope it was helpful....hang in there...and you will obviously know better as to what's going on and what they will have to do closer to your due date.   Good luck to you!

I have high blood pressure controlled by meds before and during my pg.  I also had gestational diabetes with my first 2 pg (not with this last one for some reason)  But I had a totally normal delivery  Even more I had a VBAC with no problems... they did monitor the baby more because of the VBAC but it was all fine and my blood pressure was fine... just keep it under control during pg with your meds and exercise (walking) because if it gets out of control it can cause growth issues with your baby

Or if there's that much problem controlling the bp do they have to take the baby as early as they can but when it's past 26 weeks.?For some reason I always thought that with my medical history (high bp, pre-diabetic, asthma) there was not a chance in heck they would want me to try a natural delivery, I always thought it would be a planned c-section but now I realize that I don't have any real basis for that thought and I don't see my Doctor til Friday so I wondered if you ladies had any insight.ThanksThanks for reading,
